text: The subcommittee hearing on Unidentified Anomalous Phenomena, or UAPs, will come to order.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: Welcome, everyone.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: Without objection, the Chair may declare a recess at any time.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: Additionally, without objection, the following members are waved on to the subcommittee for
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: the purpose of participating in today's hearing.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: Mr. Burchard of Tennessee, Ms. Luna of Florida, Mr. Getz of Florida, Mr. Burleson of Missouri,
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: Mrs. Ocasio-Cortez of New York, and Mr. Ogles of Tennessee.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: Without objection, so ordered.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: For today's subcommittee hearing, both the Chair and Ranking Member will have 10 minutes
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: for opening remarks.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: We may both be giving some of those minutes to other members of our party.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: I'm now going to recognize myself for 10 minutes.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: I'm actually going to try to get out of here in about 4, and then we'll give it to some
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: of my friends over here.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: Good morning and welcome to the most exciting subcommittee in Congress this week, the Subcommittee
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: on National Security of the Board and Foreign Affairs, for discussion of Unidentified Anomalous
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: Phenomena.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: I'd like to thank the brave military pilots and personnel, such as the witnesses on the
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: panel today, for sharing their stories on how they have engaged UAPs, which has brought
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: attention to this matter.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: Curiosity and speculation from all walks of life have generated interest in studying
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: what UAPs are and what threats they may pose.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: I will say that when I was younger in school, I read a book, a 1966 book called Flying Saucers,
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: Serious Business, and for a while when I was a little bit younger, I thought it was the
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: most important issue out there.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: The lack of a transparency regarding UAPs, which was one of the themes of that book,
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: in any event, it's like interest in studying what UAPs are and what threats they pose.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: The lack of transparency regarding UAPs has fueled wild speculation and debate for decades
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: eroding public trust in the very institutions that are meant to serve and protect them.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: As is evidenced by the large number of people we have here.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: I also want to point out, in 1966, President Gerald Ford claimed to have seen a UFO, and
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: in 1969, in Georgia, Jimmy Carter claimed to have seen a UFO.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: This has led Congress to establish entities to examine UAPs.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: The National Defense Authorization Act of 2022 established the All-Domain Anomaly Resolution
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: Office, or AARO, to coordinate efforts across the Department of Defense and other federal
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: agencies to detect, identify, and investigate UAPs.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: However, AARO's budget remains classified, prohibiting meaningful oversight from Congress.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: In addition to AARO's efforts, NASA is leading an independent study on UAPs that will identify
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: how UAP data is gathered from both civilian and government entities that can be analyzed
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: to shed light on the topic.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: However, despite these offices being established, there lies a pressing demand for government
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: transparency and accountability that cannot be overlooked, and that's been a problem that's
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: been around for 50 years.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: The Biden administration handling of the Chinese spy balloon that violated U.S. airspace is
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: one example of how the government is not prepared for these.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: The Biden administration's description of events has shown that the government continues
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: not to be forthright.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: Between the Chinese balloon being shot down and two UAPs subsequently shot down following
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: the event earlier this year, the U.S. government spent one and a half million dollars in taxpayer
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: dollars on missiles, yet we have seen little clarity from the Biden administration.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: We must demand transparency from the Department of Defense, our intelligent community, and
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: our defense industry on the UAP work.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: We're going to ask some questions about that today.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: Congress recognizes the subject of UAPs as multifaceted and requires a careful, data-driven
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: approach.
speaker: SPEAKER 1

text: Today, we'll see clarity from these witnesses' testimonies, and we'll see clarity as to what
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: can be done to improve reporting for military and civilians and remain committed to objective
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: inquiry.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: Congress should work to ensure that knowledge is not driven by fear.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: Today we are not just obeying the existence of UAPs, we are deliberating on the principles
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: that define our republic, which is a commitment to transparency and accountability.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: I look forward to hearing from our witnesses today about ways we can improve government
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: efficiency and openness when it comes to UAPs.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: I thank each of you for your presence here today and for your dedication to safeguarding
speaker: SPEAKER 4

text: the interests of the American people.
speaker: SPEAKER 4

speaker: SPEAKER 4
